intro: Apodytes giung, commonly known as the African sandthorn, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and spiny leaves. The plant produces small, orange-colored fruits that are edible but have a bitter taste. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Apodytes giung is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
